intro: Scillopsis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf scillopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, narrow leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale blue, bloom in spring and are attractive to pollinators. Scillopsis angustifolia is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in the southeastern regions of the United States.
